metadata.synopsis: A lower city denizen visits the Guildhall for a drink with his friend. In truth, he's being fed drink by this sober friend to keep him out of trouble. But he knows where to listen, and has learned the location of the Stone Lord's ambush. We can learn it from him if we put up with his shit long enough.

63.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
63.text: Welcome t'the Guildhall! Faerûn's finest festhall, s'long as you're not sober.
63.context: NodeContext: Turning to player with a welcoming nod

20.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
20.text: That's my last one. Going home.

21.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
21.text: See - see - Nine-Fingers is a master of stratergic - strateegil - she's clever, Phos.
21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holding forth to his drinking buddy, absolutely pissed

45.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
45.text: Won't fight the Stone Lord out in th'open. But she's got a spot picked out, see, an'-

19.speaker: Phostlethwaite
19.text: Don't care about Stone Lord, Tut. Don't care about some ambush. I asked - d'you eat my last pickled ooze?

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Wait. I want to hear about the Stone Lord. Let him finish.

15.speaker: Phostlethwaite
15.text: Eh? Bugger off. I'm TALKIN' to my FRIEN' about an OOZE.

83.speaker: Jaheira
83.text: Now, now - he who keeps his manners keeps his teeth, too. Besides, you are only pretending to be as wine-soaked as your friend here.

90.speaker: Phostlethwaite
90.context: NodeContext: Rumbled - he'd been pretending to be drunk and was about to dispute being called out, but switches to hushed tones instead - has no idea how he was spotted so easily

22.speaker: Jaheira
22.text: I've been to fouler fest-halls than this. And you have the stage presence of a Volothamp Geddarm.
22.context: NodeContext: Nonchalant - she doesn't rate this guy's acting skills

32.speaker: Jaheira
32.text: Now - you were speaking to my friend. Politely.
32.context: NodeContext: Returning to topic, but sweetly reminding the thug of her threat if he's rude again

86.speaker: Player
86.text: Why are you pretending to be drunk?

74.speaker: Narrator
74.text: *Unlike his elder, the younger halfling - Phos - is stone cold sober. But for some reason, he's feigning drunkenness.*

66.speaker: Player
66.text: You're sober - so why are you pretending you're not?

9.speaker: Phostlethwaite
9.text: Back to sleep! Look, Tut here is an old friend of Nine-Fingers - saved her as a kid or some such, I don't know.
9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gestures at Tut, focusing on us - dropping the drunk act and speaking in hushed tones.NodeContext: Gestures at Tut, focusing on us - dropping the drunk act and speaking in hushed tones.

35.speaker: Phostlethwaite
35.text: But if I don't keep him busy like she asked, he's likely to run off and try to take on the Stone Lord himself.
35.context: NodeContext: Hushed, urgent - we're going to get him in trouble

7.speaker: Phostlethwaite
7.text: So Tut's gonna tell you what he knows about the Stone Lord, you're going to leave us to our merry old time, and you're not going to put my name near any of this - yes?
7.context: NodeContext: Hushed, barely-restrained impatience - laying out the terms by which he'll help in return for us leaving

64.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
64.text: Stone Lord, aye! Bastard's going after the Counting House - but he doesn't know that that's just another Guild operation. Heh.
64.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jerking back to sudden consciousness as if he hadn't been falling asleep.NodeContext: Drunkenly finding a place in his story. Relish, slyly revealing that the Counting House is actually run by the criminal Guild

62.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
62.text: Nine-Fingers is gonna catch him with his claws in her coffers. I pity the bastard.
62.context: NodeContext: Relish at the violent fate that awaits the Stone Lord.

75.speaker: Jaheira
75.text: The Counting House...? But what the hells could Minsc want there?

33.speaker: Phostlethwaite
33.text: Happy? Now - away wir ye. We wan' drink in peace.
33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Happy is pointed to us, dead sober - then resuming his drunk act and shoooing us away

91.speaker: Player
91.text: Let's settle the matter of the ooze first, then. It's clearly important.

37.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
37.text: Didn't eat it. S'one way to prove it, if you really wan' help.

42.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Tut leans forward and belches in our face.

79.speaker: Narrator
79.text: *An assailing mist dampens your face - stale beer, garlic, and whatever else lurks in Tut's stomach.*
79.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player flinches from burp - using one of the NEGATIVE or HANDSUP_STOP reaction anims.

41.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
41.text: Hah! How y'like the smell of innocence? Bu' you're a good sport - so what was I sayin'?

77.speaker: Jaheira
77.text: The Stone Lord. And swiftly, please - I can only hold my breath for so long.
77.context: NodeContext: Repressed disgust. We were just assaulted with a vile but genial belch.

52.speaker: Narrator
52.text: *As for the contents of your own stomach...*
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks disgusted, and steps back from NPC

92.speaker: Jaheira
92.text: Must you embarrass me in front of the city's lower life-forms?
92.context: NodeContext: Muted disgust - we just puked while interrogating a Guild member that she had intimidated.

10.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
10.text: Ugh! You're disgus- disgus-... You're a mess, mate.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Waste any more of my time, and I will turn you into a pickled ooze.

38.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
38.text: No need f'such sauce, my friend. You're lucky I'm a happy drunk. Now - where was I?
38.context: NodeContext: Drunkenly affronted, haughtily deigns to return to his story

3.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
3.text: Don't... don't... don't even know what that means.
3.context: NodeContext: Unconcerned by our threat, drunkenly trailing off.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: I'm just here to listen to his fine man's tale about the Stone Lord.

0.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
0.text: See, Phos? This'un has RESPEC'! Now, where was I...

78.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
78.text: Ease off, eh mate? I don't even let Phos kiss me arse like that.
78.context: NodeContext: He's drunk, but even he's embarrassed with how sycophantic the player is being.

39.speaker: Phostlethwaite
39.text: I never... I never asked him to.
39.context: NodeContext: Phos, a little panicked, wanting to clarify with us that he never asked to kiss Tut's arse.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: I've got a tab running at the bar. Indulge me and I'll keep it open, just for you.

48.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
48.text: You. You are a very beautiful person.
48.context: NodeContext: Utter sincerity. He'd adopt us if he could.

2.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
2.text: I can buy m'own bloody drinks, thanks.

30.speaker: Phostlethwaite
30.text: Managed to keep out of the worst of the fighting. Now just need to keep from sobering up.

34.speaker: Phostlethwaite
34.text: Can't lie. It's a relief to have that old fart off my hands.

67.speaker: Phostlethwaite
67.text: He's all riled up. Best you do g'way.
67.context: NodeContext: Drunken tone, apologetic for his friend

55.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
55.text: D'ya see? I killed ten of 'em, without even droppin' me mug.

57.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
57.context: NodeContext: drunk, squinting up at us - looking for his friend, but too drink to care that much

88.speaker: Tut Thistlebog
88.text: Heard it, one of Glitterbeard's lads tellin' tales! The Stone Lord got 'et by a mimic, and bust his way clean out!

81.speaker: Phostlethwaite
81.text: Right, Tut. I think you've had enough.
